69    private static ByteBuffer asByteBuffer(String i) {
70      return ByteBuffer.wrap(Bytes.toBytes(i));

73      return ByteBuffer.wrap(Bytes.toBytes(l));

138   /**
139    * Tests if the metrics for thrift handler work correctly
140    */
141   public void doTestThriftMetrics() throws Exception {
142     Configuration conf = UTIL.getConfiguration();
143     ThriftMetrics metrics = getMetrics(conf);
144     Hbase.Iface handler = getHandler(metrics, conf);
145     createTestTables(handler);
146     dropTestTables(handler);
147     verifyMetrics(metrics, "createTable_num_ops", 2);
148     verifyMetrics(metrics, "deleteTable_num_ops", 2);
149     verifyMetrics(metrics, "disableTable_num_ops", 2);
150   }
151 
152   private static Hbase.Iface getHandler(ThriftMetrics metrics, Configuration conf)
153       throws Exception {
154     Hbase.Iface handler =
155       new ThriftServerRunner.HBaseHandler(conf);
156     return HbaseHandlerMetricsProxy.newInstance(handler, metrics, conf);
157   }
158 
159   private static ThriftMetrics getMetrics(Configuration conf) throws Exception {
160     setupMetricsContext();
161     return new ThriftMetrics(ThriftServerRunner.DEFAULT_LISTEN_PORT, conf, Hbase.Iface.class);
162   }
163 
164   private static void setupMetricsContext() throws IOException {
165     ContextFactory factory = ContextFactory.getFactory();
166     factory.setAttribute(ThriftMetrics.CONTEXT_NAME + ".class",
167         NoEmitMetricsContext.class.getName());
168     MetricsUtil.getContext(ThriftMetrics.CONTEXT_NAME)
169                .createRecord(ThriftMetrics.CONTEXT_NAME).remove();
170   }
171 
172   private static void verifyMetrics(ThriftMetrics metrics, String name, int expectValue)
173       throws Exception {
174     MetricsContext context = MetricsUtil.getContext(
175         ThriftMetrics.CONTEXT_NAME);
176     metrics.doUpdates(context);
177     OutputRecord record = context.getAllRecords().get(
178         ThriftMetrics.CONTEXT_NAME).iterator().next();
179     assertEquals(expectValue, record.getMetric(name).intValue());
180   }

182   public static void createTestTables(Hbase.Iface handler) throws Exception {
183     // Create/enable/disable/delete tables, ensure methods act correctly
184     assertEquals(handler.getTableNames().size(), 0);
185     handler.createTable(tableAname, getColumnDescriptors());
186     assertEquals(handler.getTableNames().size(), 1);
187     assertEquals(handler.getColumnDescriptors(tableAname).size(), 2);
188     assertTrue(handler.isTableEnabled(tableAname));
189     handler.createTable(tableBname, new ArrayList<ColumnDescriptor>());
190     assertEquals(handler.getTableNames().size(), 2);
191   }

195   }

197   public static void dropTestTables(Hbase.Iface handler) throws Exception {
198     handler.disableTable(tableBname);
199     assertFalse(handler.isTableEnabled(tableBname));
200     handler.deleteTable(tableBname);
201     assertEquals(handler.getTableNames().size(), 1);
202     handler.disableTable(tableAname);
203     /* TODO Reenable.
204     assertFalse(handler.isTableEnabled(tableAname));
205     handler.enableTable(tableAname);
206     assertTrue(handler.isTableEnabled(tableAname));
207     handler.disableTable(tableAname);*/
208     handler.deleteTable(tableAname);
209   }

219   public static void doTestIncrements(HBaseHandler handler) throws Exception {
220     List<Mutation> mutations = new ArrayList<Mutation>(1);
221     mutations.add(new Mutation(false, columnAAname, valueEname, true));
222     mutations.add(new Mutation(false, columnAname, valueEname, true));
223     handler.mutateRow(tableAname, rowAname, mutations, null);
224     handler.mutateRow(tableAname, rowBname, mutations, null);
225 
226     List<TIncrement> increments = new ArrayList<TIncrement>();
227     increments.add(new TIncrement(tableAname, rowBname, columnAAname, 7));
228     increments.add(new TIncrement(tableAname, rowBname, columnAAname, 7));
229     increments.add(new TIncrement(tableAname, rowBname, columnAAname, 7));
230 
231     int numIncrements = 60000;
232     for (int i = 0; i < numIncrements; i++) {
233       handler.increment(new TIncrement(tableAname, rowAname, columnAname, 2));
234       handler.incrementRows(increments);
235     }
236 
237     Thread.sleep(1000);
238     long lv = handler.get(tableAname, rowAname, columnAname, null).get(0).value.getLong();
239     assertEquals((100 + (2 * numIncrements)), lv );
240 
241 
242     lv = handler.get(tableAname, rowBname, columnAAname, null).get(0).value.getLong();
243     assertEquals((100 + (3 * 7 * numIncrements)), lv);
244 
245     assertTrue(handler.coalescer.getSuccessfulCoalescings() > 0);
246 
247   }

262   public static void doTestTableMutations(Hbase.Iface handler) throws Exception {
263     // Setup
264     handler.createTable(tableAname, getColumnDescriptors());
265 
266     // Apply a few Mutations to rowA
267     //     mutations.add(new Mutation(false, columnAname, valueAname));
268     //     mutations.add(new Mutation(false, columnBname, valueBname));
269     handler.mutateRow(tableAname, rowAname, getMutations(), null);
270 
271     // Assert that the changes were made
272     assertEquals(valueAname,
273       handler.get(tableAname, rowAname, columnAname, null).get(0).value);
274     TRowResult rowResult1 = handler.getRow(tableAname, rowAname, null).get(0);
275     assertEquals(rowAname, rowResult1.row);
276     assertEquals(valueBname,
277       rowResult1.columns.get(columnBname).value);
278 
279     // Apply a few BatchMutations for rowA and rowB
280     // rowAmutations.add(new Mutation(true, columnAname, null));
281     // rowAmutations.add(new Mutation(false, columnBname, valueCname));
282     // batchMutations.add(new BatchMutation(rowAname, rowAmutations));
283     // Mutations to rowB
284     // rowBmutations.add(new Mutation(false, columnAname, valueCname));
285     // rowBmutations.add(new Mutation(false, columnBname, valueDname));
286     // batchMutations.add(new BatchMutation(rowBname, rowBmutations));
287     handler.mutateRows(tableAname, getBatchMutations(), null);
288 
289     // Assert that changes were made to rowA
290     List<TCell> cells = handler.get(tableAname, rowAname, columnAname, null);
291     assertFalse(cells.size() > 0);
292     assertEquals(valueCname, handler.get(tableAname, rowAname, columnBname, null).get(0).value);
293     List<TCell> versions = handler.getVer(tableAname, rowAname, columnBname, MAXVERSIONS, null);
294     assertEquals(valueCname, versions.get(0).value);
295     assertEquals(valueBname, versions.get(1).value);
296 
297     // Assert that changes were made to rowB
298     TRowResult rowResult2 = handler.getRow(tableAname, rowBname, null).get(0);
299     assertEquals(rowBname, rowResult2.row);
300     assertEquals(valueCname, rowResult2.columns.get(columnAname).value);
301     assertEquals(valueDname, rowResult2.columns.get(columnBname).value);
302 
303     // Apply some deletes
304     handler.deleteAll(tableAname, rowAname, columnBname, null);
305     handler.deleteAllRow(tableAname, rowBname, null);
306 
307     // Assert that the deletes were applied
308     int size = handler.get(tableAname, rowAname, columnBname, null).size();
309     assertEquals(0, size);
310     size = handler.getRow(tableAname, rowBname, null).size();
311     assertEquals(0, size);
312 
313     // Try null mutation
314     List<Mutation> mutations = new ArrayList<Mutation>();
315     mutations.add(new Mutation(false, columnAname, null, true));
316     handler.mutateRow(tableAname, rowAname, mutations, null);
317     TRowResult rowResult3 = handler.getRow(tableAname, rowAname, null).get(0);
318     assertEquals(rowAname, rowResult3.row);
319     assertEquals(0, rowResult3.columns.get(columnAname).value.remaining());
320 
321     // Teardown
322     handler.disableTable(tableAname);
323     handler.deleteTable(tableAname);
324   }

326   /**
327    * Similar to testTableMutations(), except Mutations are applied with
328    * specific timestamps and data retrieval uses these timestamps to
329    * extract specific versions of data.
330    *
331    * @throws Exception
332    */
333   public void doTestTableTimestampsAndColumns() throws Exception {
334     // Setup
335     ThriftServerRunner.HBaseHandler handler =
336       new ThriftServerRunner.HBaseHandler(UTIL.getConfiguration());
337     handler.createTable(tableAname, getColumnDescriptors());
338 
339     // Apply timestamped Mutations to rowA
340     long time1 = System.currentTimeMillis();
341     handler.mutateRowTs(tableAname, rowAname, getMutations(), time1, null);
342 
343     Thread.sleep(1000);
344 
345     // Apply timestamped BatchMutations for rowA and rowB
346     long time2 = System.currentTimeMillis();
347     handler.mutateRowsTs(tableAname, getBatchMutations(), time2, null);
348 
349     // Apply an overlapping timestamped mutation to rowB
350     handler.mutateRowTs(tableAname, rowBname, getMutations(), time2, null);
351 
352     // the getVerTs is [inf, ts) so you need to increment one.
353     time1 += 1;
354     time2 += 2;
355 
356     // Assert that the timestamp-related methods retrieve the correct data
357     assertEquals(2, handler.getVerTs(tableAname, rowAname, columnBname, time2,
358       MAXVERSIONS, null).size());
359     assertEquals(1, handler.getVerTs(tableAname, rowAname, columnBname, time1,
360       MAXVERSIONS, null).size());
361 
362     TRowResult rowResult1 = handler.getRowTs(tableAname, rowAname, time1, null).get(0);
363     TRowResult rowResult2 = handler.getRowTs(tableAname, rowAname, time2, null).get(0);
364     // columnA was completely deleted
365     //assertTrue(Bytes.equals(rowResult1.columns.get(columnAname).value, valueAname));
366     assertEquals(rowResult1.columns.get(columnBname).value, valueBname);
367     assertEquals(rowResult2.columns.get(columnBname).value, valueCname);
368 
369     // ColumnAname has been deleted, and will never be visible even with a getRowTs()
370     assertFalse(rowResult2.columns.containsKey(columnAname));
371 
372     List<ByteBuffer> columns = new ArrayList<ByteBuffer>();
373     columns.add(columnBname);
374 
375     rowResult1 = handler.getRowWithColumns(tableAname, rowAname, columns, null).get(0);
376     assertEquals(rowResult1.columns.get(columnBname).value, valueCname);
377     assertFalse(rowResult1.columns.containsKey(columnAname));
378 
379     rowResult1 = handler.getRowWithColumnsTs(tableAname, rowAname, columns, time1, null).get(0);
380     assertEquals(rowResult1.columns.get(columnBname).value, valueBname);
381     assertFalse(rowResult1.columns.containsKey(columnAname));
382 
383     // Apply some timestamped deletes
384     // this actually deletes _everything_.
385     // nukes everything in columnB: forever.
386     handler.deleteAllTs(tableAname, rowAname, columnBname, time1, null);
387     handler.deleteAllRowTs(tableAname, rowBname, time2, null);
388 
389     // Assert that the timestamp-related methods retrieve the correct data
390     int size = handler.getVerTs(tableAname, rowAname, columnBname, time1, MAXVERSIONS, null).size();
391     assertEquals(0, size);
392 
393     size = handler.getVerTs(tableAname, rowAname, columnBname, time2, MAXVERSIONS, null).size();
394     assertEquals(1, size);
395 
396     // should be available....
397     assertEquals(handler.get(tableAname, rowAname, columnBname, null).get(0).value, valueCname);
398 
399     assertEquals(0, handler.getRow(tableAname, rowBname, null).size());
400 
401     // Teardown
402     handler.disableTable(tableAname);
403     handler.deleteTable(tableAname);
404   }

406   /**
407    * Tests the four different scanner-opening methods (with and without
408    * a stoprow, with and without a timestamp).
409    *
410    * @throws Exception
411    */
412   public void doTestTableScanners() throws Exception {
413     // Setup
414     ThriftServerRunner.HBaseHandler handler =
415       new ThriftServerRunner.HBaseHandler(UTIL.getConfiguration());
416     handler.createTable(tableAname, getColumnDescriptors());
417 
418     // Apply timestamped Mutations to rowA
419     long time1 = System.currentTimeMillis();
420     handler.mutateRowTs(tableAname, rowAname, getMutations(), time1, null);
421 
422     // Sleep to assure that 'time1' and 'time2' will be different even with a
423     // coarse grained system timer.
424     Thread.sleep(1000);
425 
426     // Apply timestamped BatchMutations for rowA and rowB
427     long time2 = System.currentTimeMillis();
428     handler.mutateRowsTs(tableAname, getBatchMutations(), time2, null);
429 
430     time1 += 1;
431 
432     // Test a scanner on all rows and all columns, no timestamp
433     int scanner1 = handler.scannerOpen(tableAname, rowAname, getColumnList(true, true), null);
434     TRowResult rowResult1a = handler.scannerGet(scanner1).get(0);
435     assertEquals(rowResult1a.row, rowAname);
436     // This used to be '1'.  I don't know why when we are asking for two columns
437     // and when the mutations above would seem to add two columns to the row.
438     // -- St.Ack 05/12/2009
439     assertEquals(rowResult1a.columns.size(), 1);
440     assertEquals(rowResult1a.columns.get(columnBname).value, valueCname);
441 
442     TRowResult rowResult1b = handler.scannerGet(scanner1).get(0);
443     assertEquals(rowResult1b.row, rowBname);
444     assertEquals(rowResult1b.columns.size(), 2);
445     assertEquals(rowResult1b.columns.get(columnAname).value, valueCname);
446     assertEquals(rowResult1b.columns.get(columnBname).value, valueDname);
447     closeScanner(scanner1, handler);
448 
449     // Test a scanner on all rows and all columns, with timestamp
450     int scanner2 = handler.scannerOpenTs(tableAname, rowAname, getColumnList(true, true), time1, null);
451     TRowResult rowResult2a = handler.scannerGet(scanner2).get(0);
452     assertEquals(rowResult2a.columns.size(), 1);
453     // column A deleted, does not exist.
454     //assertTrue(Bytes.equals(rowResult2a.columns.get(columnAname).value, valueAname));
455     assertEquals(rowResult2a.columns.get(columnBname).value, valueBname);
456     closeScanner(scanner2, handler);
457 
458     // Test a scanner on the first row and first column only, no timestamp
459     int scanner3 = handler.scannerOpenWithStop(tableAname, rowAname, rowBname,
460         getColumnList(true, false), null);
461     closeScanner(scanner3, handler);
462 
463     // Test a scanner on the first row and second column only, with timestamp
464     int scanner4 = handler.scannerOpenWithStopTs(tableAname, rowAname, rowBname,
465         getColumnList(false, true), time1, null);
466     TRowResult rowResult4a = handler.scannerGet(scanner4).get(0);
467     assertEquals(rowResult4a.columns.size(), 1);
468     assertEquals(rowResult4a.columns.get(columnBname).value, valueBname);
469 
470     // Test scanner using a TScan object once with sortColumns False and once with sortColumns true
471     TScan scanNoSortColumns = new TScan();
472     scanNoSortColumns.setStartRow(rowAname);
473     scanNoSortColumns.setStopRow(rowBname);
474 
475     int scanner5 = handler.scannerOpenWithScan(tableAname , scanNoSortColumns, null);
476     TRowResult rowResult5 = handler.scannerGet(scanner5).get(0);
477     assertEquals(rowResult5.columns.size(), 1);
478     assertEquals(rowResult5.columns.get(columnBname).value, valueCname);
479 
480     TScan scanSortColumns = new TScan();
481     scanSortColumns.setStartRow(rowAname);
482     scanSortColumns.setStopRow(rowBname);
483     scanSortColumns = scanSortColumns.setSortColumns(true);
484 
485     int scanner6 = handler.scannerOpenWithScan(tableAname ,scanSortColumns, null);
486     TRowResult rowResult6 = handler.scannerGet(scanner6).get(0);
487     assertEquals(rowResult6.sortedColumns.size(), 1);
488     assertEquals(rowResult6.sortedColumns.get(0).getCell().value, valueCname);
489 
490     List<Mutation> rowBmutations = new ArrayList<Mutation>();
491     for (int i = 0; i < 20; i++) {
492       rowBmutations.add(new Mutation(false, asByteBuffer("columnA:" + i), valueCname, true));
493     }
494     ByteBuffer rowC = asByteBuffer("rowC");
495     handler.mutateRow(tableAname, rowC, rowBmutations, null);
496 
497     TScan scanSortMultiColumns = new TScan();
498     scanSortMultiColumns.setStartRow(rowC);
499     scanSortMultiColumns = scanSortMultiColumns.setSortColumns(true);
500     int scanner7 = handler.scannerOpenWithScan(tableAname, scanSortMultiColumns, null);
501     TRowResult rowResult7 = handler.scannerGet(scanner7).get(0);
502 
503     ByteBuffer smallerColumn = asByteBuffer("columnA:");
504     for (int i = 0; i < 20; i++) {
505       ByteBuffer currentColumn = rowResult7.sortedColumns.get(i).columnName;
506       assertTrue(Bytes.compareTo(smallerColumn.array(), currentColumn.array()) < 0);
507       smallerColumn = currentColumn;
508     }
509 
510     // Teardown
511     handler.disableTable(tableAname);
512     handler.deleteTable(tableAname);
513   }

515   /**
516    * For HBASE-2556
517    * Tests for GetTableRegions
518    *
519    * @throws Exception
520    */
521   public void doTestGetTableRegions() throws Exception {
522     ThriftServerRunner.HBaseHandler handler =
523       new ThriftServerRunner.HBaseHandler(UTIL.getConfiguration());
524     doTestGetTableRegions(handler);
525   }
526 
527   public static void doTestGetTableRegions(Hbase.Iface handler)
528       throws Exception {
529     assertEquals(handler.getTableNames().size(), 0);
530     handler.createTable(tableAname, getColumnDescriptors());
531     assertEquals(handler.getTableNames().size(), 1);
532     List<TRegionInfo> regions = handler.getTableRegions(tableAname);
533     int regionCount = regions.size();
534     assertEquals("empty table should have only 1 region, " +
535             "but found " + regionCount, regionCount, 1);
536     LOG.info("Region found:" + regions.get(0));
537     handler.disableTable(tableAname);
538     handler.deleteTable(tableAname);
539     regionCount = handler.getTableRegions(tableAname).size();
540     assertEquals("non-existing table should have 0 region, " +
541             "but found " + regionCount, regionCount, 0);
542   }

544   public void doTestFilterRegistration() throws Exception {
545     Configuration conf = UTIL.getConfiguration();
546 
547     conf.set("hbase.thrift.filters", "MyFilter:filterclass");
548 
549     ThriftServerRunner.registerFilters(conf);
550 
551     Map<String, String> registeredFilters = ParseFilter.getAllFilters();
552 
553     assertEquals("filterclass", registeredFilters.get("MyFilter"));
554   }

556   /**
557    *
558    * @return a List of ColumnDescriptors for use in creating a table.  Has one
559    * default ColumnDescriptor and one ColumnDescriptor with fewer versions
560    */
561   private static List<ColumnDescriptor> getColumnDescriptors() {
562     ArrayList<ColumnDescriptor> cDescriptors = new ArrayList<ColumnDescriptor>();
563 
564     // A default ColumnDescriptor
565     ColumnDescriptor cDescA = new ColumnDescriptor();
566     cDescA.name = columnAname;
567     cDescriptors.add(cDescA);
568 
569     // A slightly customized ColumnDescriptor (only 2 versions)
570     ColumnDescriptor cDescB = new ColumnDescriptor(columnBname, 2, "NONE",
571         false, "NONE", 0, 0, false, -1);
572     cDescriptors.add(cDescB);
573 
574     return cDescriptors;
575   }

577   /**
578    *
579    * @param includeA whether or not to include columnA
580    * @param includeB whether or not to include columnB
581    * @return a List of column names for use in retrieving a scanner
582    */
583   private List<ByteBuffer> getColumnList(boolean includeA, boolean includeB) {
584     List<ByteBuffer> columnList = new ArrayList<ByteBuffer>();
585     if (includeA) columnList.add(columnAname);
586     if (includeB) columnList.add(columnBname);
587     return columnList;
588   }

590   /**
591    *
592    * @return a List of Mutations for a row, with columnA having valueA
593    * and columnB having valueB
594    */
595   private static List<Mutation> getMutations() {
596     List<Mutation> mutations = new ArrayList<Mutation>();
597     mutations.add(new Mutation(false, columnAname, valueAname, true));
598     mutations.add(new Mutation(false, columnBname, valueBname, true));
599     return mutations;
600   }
601 
602   /**
603    *
604    * @return a List of BatchMutations with the following effects:
605    * (rowA, columnA): delete
606    * (rowA, columnB): place valueC
607    * (rowB, columnA): place valueC
608    * (rowB, columnB): place valueD
609    */
610   private static List<BatchMutation> getBatchMutations() {
611     List<BatchMutation> batchMutations = new ArrayList<BatchMutation>();
612 
613     // Mutations to rowA.  You can't mix delete and put anymore.
614     List<Mutation> rowAmutations = new ArrayList<Mutation>();
615     rowAmutations.add(new Mutation(true, columnAname, null, true));
616     batchMutations.add(new BatchMutation(rowAname, rowAmutations));
617 
618     rowAmutations = new ArrayList<Mutation>();
619     rowAmutations.add(new Mutation(false, columnBname, valueCname, true));
620     batchMutations.add(new BatchMutation(rowAname, rowAmutations));
621 
622     // Mutations to rowB
623     List<Mutation> rowBmutations = new ArrayList<Mutation>();
624     rowBmutations.add(new Mutation(false, columnAname, valueCname, true));
625     rowBmutations.add(new Mutation(false, columnBname, valueDname, true));
626     batchMutations.add(new BatchMutation(rowBname, rowBmutations));
627 
628     return batchMutations;
629   }

631   /**
632    * Asserts that the passed scanner is exhausted, and then closes
633    * the scanner.
634    *
635    * @param scannerId the scanner to close
636    * @param handler the HBaseHandler interfacing to HBase
637    * @throws Exception
638    */
639   private void closeScanner(
640       int scannerId, ThriftServerRunner.HBaseHandler handler) throws Exception {
641     handler.scannerGet(scannerId);
642     handler.scannerClose(scannerId);
643   }
